result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel P McClain

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Samuel P McClain in court.  
Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court for Samuel P McClain.  
Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Status  Conference. Defense request a resolution hearing. 
Defense advised plea documents to be submitted to the court 24-hours in advance of the hearing. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Parties advised this hearing will be held in person.
Plea and Sentencing scheduled January 6, 2023 at 9:30am.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Samuel P McClain not in court, in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel advises the court he believes the defendant is at CDC and request an adjournment of today's proceedings. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Samuel P McClain not in court, in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Status Conference. Discussions placed on the record. Defense requested Scheduling Conference date. Case Adjourned in Branch 45.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

HELD OFF THE RECORD
Defendant Samuel P McClain in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Samuel P McClain in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY ZOOM.
Case set for Status following 22CF447. Case adjourn for Status.  Status conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Samuel P McClain in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Samuel P McClain in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Scheduling Conference held.  Case in Court with defendant's other case 22CF990.  Case adjourned, Br. PE.  Status conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Samuel P McClain not in court, in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defendant no produced for today's hearing. Defense requested an additional scheduling conference date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Samuel P McClain in court by video with Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke who appears in person.  Defendant Samuel P McClain in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
No driving without a valid license and insurance.

Defendant Samuel P McClain in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Samuel P McClain in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Samuel P McClain appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Samuel P McClain not in court.  Elizabeth A Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/21/22 @ 2p
